Registry of Open Data on AWS

Southern California Earthquake Data

earth observation earthquakes seismology sustainability

Description

This dataset contains ground motion velocity and acceleration seismic waveforms recorded by the Southern California Seismic Network (SCSN) and archived at the Southern California Earthquake Data Center (SCEDC).

Update Frequency

Daily

License

SCEDC herby grants the non-exclusive, royalty free, non-transferable, worldwide right and license to use, reproduce and publicly display in all media public data from the Southern California Seismic Network. Please cite the SCEDC (doi:10.7909/C3WD3xH1) and SCSN (doi:10.7914/SN/CI) for any research publications using this data.

Documentation

https://scedc.caltech.edu/data/cloud.html

Managed By

Southern California Earthquake Data Center

See all datasets managed by Southern California Earthquake Data Center.

Contact

scedc@gps.caltech.edu

Usage Examples

Tutorials
  • Cactus to Clouds: Processing The SCEDC Open Data Set on AWS by Tim Clements
  • Getting Started with SCEDC AWS Public Dataset by Ellen Yu
  • Script to Download Seismic Waveforms from the SCEDC AWS Public Dataset by Aparna Bhaskaran
  • SeisNoise.jl GPU Computing Tutorial - Another example of accessing data s3://scedc-pds for ambient noise cross-correlation by Tim Clements
  • Using Lambda to Process Seismograms by Shang-Lin Chen

Resources on AWS

  • Description
    Seismic waveform data (miniSEED format) and earthquake catalog (ascii)
    Resource type
    S3 Bucket
    Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
    arn:aws:s3:::scedc-pds
    AWS Region
    us-west-2
    AWS CLI Access (No AWS account required)
    aws s3 ls s3://scedc-pds/ --no-sign-request
